R.content: for Aristotle, the One [i.e. Prime Mover] is above multiplicity, we should not all be kings, Aristotle’s against polykoirania
R.linkedContent: for Aristotle, the One [i.e. Prime Mover] is above multiplicity, we should not all be kings, Aristotle’s against polykoirania

R.content: roué qualifies one who turns a trick, the voyou (rogue) w/ his leading astray (dévoiement), debauchery, worklessness, always a seduction, licentious, libertine [always men, sexual difference]
R.linkedContent: roué qualifies one who turns a trick, the voyou (rogue) w/ his leading astray (dévoiement), debauchery, worklessness, always a seduction, licentious, libertine [always men, sexual difference]

R.content: democracy always associated w/ this figure, w/ taking too many liberties, libertine, liberalism, “everything is allowed,” announces a beheading of monarchical sovereignty
R.linkedContent: democracy always associated w/ this figure, w/ taking too many liberties, libertine, liberalism, “everything is allowed,” announces a beheading of monarchical sovereignty

R.content: acc. Statesmen of Plato, Politics of Aristotle, democracy, government of greatest #, is only best when laws are broken, exact reverse of Monarchy
R.linkedContent: acc. Statesmen of Plato, Politics of Aristotle, democracy, government of greatest #, is only best when laws are broken, exact reverse of Monarchy

HERP.content: Heidegger thinks father as “Erzeuger,” one that produces, makes bloom, thinks king as “waltender Bewahrer,” guardian that governs, rules across, reigns over presence
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger thinks father as “Erzeuger,” one that produces, makes bloom, thinks king as “waltender Bewahrer,” guardian that governs, rules across, reigns over presence

FWT.content: the 2 competing discourses justifying regicide [re: French Revolution]: 1) king is enemy of nation 2) a citizen traitor [porous borders btwn these logics, Schmitt’s “partisan”]
FWT.linkedContent: the 2 competing discourses justifying regicide [re: French Revolution]: 1) king is enemy of nation 2) a citizen traitor [porous borders btwn these logics, Schmitt’s “partisan”]

FWT.content: for Kant, nothing more ruinous for foundations of sovereignty than “formal” regicide; ——was king killed or just his body? (“formal” execution, judgement vs. assassination)
FWT.linkedContent: for Kant, nothing more ruinous for foundations of sovereignty than “formal” regicide; ——was king killed or just his body? (“formal” execution, judgement vs. assassination)

FWT.content: for Hugo, “social edifice of past” rested on 3 pillars: 1) priest 2) king 3) executioner
FWT.linkedContent: for Hugo, “social edifice of past” rested on 3 pillars: 1) priest 2) king 3) executioner

PP.content: Plato speaks about writing from position of king? while suspecting non-“democratic” politics of writing
PP.linkedContent: Plato speaks about writing from position of king? while suspecting non-“democratic” politics of writing

DIF.content: differance not announced by capital letter, it subverts all kingdoms > everything w/in us that wants a kingdom (le royaume) (that wants to capitalize) fears differance
DIF.linkedContent: differance not announced by capital letter, it subverts all kingdoms > everything w/in us that wants a kingdom (le royaume) (that wants to capitalize) fears differance

DPi.content: in logic where king has 2 bodies (carnal, immortal), beheading king, splitting king in 2, reduces king to 1 single body: either a noncitizen (public enemy) or citizen traitor
DPi.linkedContent: in logic where king has 2 bodies (carnal, immortal), beheading king, splitting king in 2, reduces king to 1 single body: either a noncitizen (public enemy) or citizen traitor

DPi.content: DP: divine weapon granted by sovereign God to sovereign monarch to fulfill providential law
DPi.linkedContent: DP: divine weapon granted by sovereign God to sovereign monarch to fulfill providential law

TB.content: promise of reconciliation (even if unfulfillable) is a rare & notable event: kingdom is never reached, is untouchable > but the commitment takes place, bequeaths its record
TB.linkedContent: promise of reconciliation (even if unfulfillable) is a rare & notable event: kingdom is never reached, is untouchable > but the commitment takes place, bequeaths its record

TB.content: for Benjamin, best translation resembles a royal cape, clothes remain separate from body while also wedding it—not wedded to it
TB.linkedContent: for Benjamin, best translation resembles a royal cape, clothes remain separate from body while also wedding it—not wedded to it

TB.content: folds of this cape, gown, protect king, it is like his scepter, visibility of law, but what counts (has power) is what’s under the cape (body of king) > don’t assume there’s a phallus underneath
TB.linkedContent: folds of this cape, gown, protect king, it is like his scepter, visibility of law, but what counts (has power) is what’s under the cape (body of king) > don’t assume there’s a phallus underneath

TB.content: hermaphrodite: royal cape as wedding gown, king inseparable from royal couple, wedding King & Queen, around which translation quilts, sews, hems, embroiders, busies its tongue
TB.linkedContent: hermaphrodite: royal cape as wedding gown, king inseparable from royal couple, wedding King & Queen, around which translation quilts, sews, hems, embroiders, busies its tongue

PSSS.content: imperative will always be the question of principle, the principle, of sovereign prince, princedom
PSSS.linkedContent: imperative will always be the question of principle, the principle, of sovereign prince, princedom

PSSS.content: who’s to say our republic is still not monarchical, that instead of a paregicide, the king’s neck was saved, erected by decapitation; never know if States General, at moment of first convocation, condemned or saved king’s head > both gestures indissociable
PSSS.linkedContent: who’s to say our republic is still not monarchical, that instead of a paregicide, the king’s neck was saved, erected by decapitation; never know if States General, at moment of first convocation, condemned or saved king’s head > both gestures indissociable

PSSS.content: condemning/saving inscribe in concepts sovereignty & cruelty an ambiguity as unrelievable as autoimmunity itself: in any paregicide, any Oedipus, any totem + taboo, any republican or democratic installation of brothers, no way to know whether paregicide took place or not, took place w/out taking place, before any question about it [see HYMEN]
PSSS.linkedContent: condemning/saving inscribe in concepts sovereignty & cruelty an ambiguity as unrelievable as autoimmunity itself: in any paregicide, any Oedipus, any totem + taboo, any republican or democratic installation of brothers, no way to know whether paregicide took place or not, took place w/out taking place, before any question about it [see HYMEN]

PSSS.content: question “What is to be done?”, not foreign to paregicide—beyond cruelty/sovereignty, w/out alibi
PSSS.linkedContent: question “What is to be done?”, not foreign to paregicide—beyond cruelty/sovereignty, w/out alibi

PSSS.content: king, authorized by God, Father of Christ
PSSS.linkedContent: king, authorized by God, Father of Christ

CF.content: right of grace, order of law above law (right beyond right): monarch’s divine right to pardon transcends/neutralizes the law > this [sovereign exception] has been reappropriated into republican heritage
CF.linkedContent: right of grace, order of law above law (right beyond right): monarch’s divine right to pardon transcends/neutralizes the law > this [sovereign exception] has been reappropriated into republican heritage

CF.content: for Hegel, only king/sovereign can forgive the unforgivable (a crime against forgiveness, against power to forgive): when ‘body of king’ in his sovereign function is threatened through other ‘body of king,’ his flesh (singular, empirical body)
CF.linkedContent: for Hegel, only king/sovereign can forgive the unforgivable (a crime against forgiveness, against power to forgive): when ‘body of king’ in his sovereign function is threatened through other ‘body of king,’ his flesh (singular, empirical body)

BSi.content: free sovereignty over social body & one’s own body (like the king’s 2 bodies) > duel w/ marionette transforms winner into a machine (in playing angel, one plays the beast [Pascal])
BSi.linkedContent: free sovereignty over social body & one’s own body (like the king’s 2 bodies) > duel w/ marionette transforms winner into a machine (in playing angel, one plays the beast [Pascal])

BSi.content: [bibliography re: king’s 2 bodies] king’s living (mortal) body has at its disposal an eternal, celestial, sublime body
BSi.linkedContent: [bibliography re: king’s 2 bodies] king’s living (mortal) body has at its disposal an eternal, celestial, sublime body

BSi.content: after death, “dignity” of king’s body during lifetime separated from “sovereignty” (majesty) that survives him, is inherited from one king to next
BSi.linkedContent: after death, “dignity” of king’s body during lifetime separated from “sovereignty” (majesty) that survives him, is inherited from one king to next

BSi.content: visor-effect: king sees w/out [his gaze, origin of his seeing, his eyes] being seen
BSi.linkedContent: visor-effect: king sees w/out [his gaze, origin of his seeing, his eyes] being seen

BSi.content: [during spectacle of autopsy/sovereignty] an éclat > fragment of light touches everything
BSi.linkedContent: [during spectacle of autopsy/sovereignty] an éclat > fragment of light touches everything

BSi.content: Marin adds 3rd body to king: 1) historical–mortal 2) politico-juridical 3) sacramental > acc. Derrida, #2 allies itself w/ #3
BSi.linkedContent: Marin adds 3rd body to king: 1) historical–mortal 2) politico-juridical 3) sacramental > acc. Derrida, #2 allies itself w/ #3

OG.content: heliocentric concept of speech, analogical system: king, father, sun, logos > [ethnocentrism of this concept: all other languages delayed logocentrism]
OG.linkedContent: heliocentric concept of speech, analogical system: king, father, sun, logos > [ethnocentrism of this concept: all other languages delayed logocentrism]

EU.content: king: someone who makes you learn his language, in learning it, you countersign his force: power demonstrated through fact of translation > this is a paradigmatic event, not structural necessity of master-slave dialectic
EU.linkedContent: king: someone who makes you learn his language, in learning it, you countersign his force: power demonstrated through fact of translation > this is a paradigmatic event, not structural necessity of master-slave dialectic

EU.content: can only say “I want to speak my mother tongue” in language of the king
EU.linkedContent: can only say “I want to speak my mother tongue” in language of the king

EU.content: relation of linguistic subjugation [forced to share language] to the clearing/controlling of borders, roads, routes, regions, territories [see p. 8 method (odos)] > power of spacing, body of writing, to clear a path (language here is neither secondary nor primary)
EU.linkedContent: relation of linguistic subjugation [forced to share language] to the clearing/controlling of borders, roads, routes, regions, territories [see p. 8 method (odos)] > power of spacing, body of writing, to clear a path (language here is neither secondary nor primary)

EU.content: via Kant, re-enforcement of law always passes by way of dead king
EU.linkedContent: via Kant, re-enforcement of law always passes by way of dead king

FV.content: dead king, Freud, only one to contract w/ himself, awaits restitution > restoration: carrying off last plume w/ his 1st hand [in dying, mobilizes many]: theory of the facteurs
FV.linkedContent: dead king, Freud, only one to contract w/ himself, awaits restitution > restoration: carrying off last plume w/ his 1st hand [in dying, mobilizes many]: theory of the facteurs
